definitions.definition: A person with authority; authority, ordinance.
(of a judge) Having regular jurisdiction; now only used in certain phrases.
Being part of the natural order of things; normal, customary, routine.
definitions.example: On an ordinary day I wake up at nine o'clock, work for six hours, and then go to the gym.

definitions.definition: Having no special characteristics or function; everyday, common, mundane; often deprecatory.
definitions.example: He looked so ordinary, I never thought he'd be capable of murder.
